Event name: Massika Mahotsav by Jove Conscious Foundation
Event DEscription:
Join Jove conscious Foundation in celebrating the five week Menstruation Festival from 10th April to 10th May.

Program Schedule 

10th April :Documentary Screening: ‘PERIOD.  End of Sentence’ followed by a discussion with Ajeya Deep from the team PERIOD.

16th and 17th April: ‘painting our way through bleeding’ Graffiti Wall Art workshop by Queerky, a team of four women Artists and painters.

23rd April: ‘Eating Right’ a session with Scope of Health by Amita Chhabra on hormonal balance, nutrition and menstrual health.

29th April: A Mental health workshop with Praggapti from Manasija on Adolescent Psychology and Mental health issues related to growing up.

5th May: ‘Sustainable Menstruation’ an awareness session on need for sustainable menstrual hygiene products by MH Research team of Rajeev Gandhi Cancer Hospital.

10th May: A panel Discussion with all the above experts on creating an ecosystem and discussion on the learnings, impact and future plan of action as the festival comes to the end, 

Moderated by Kritika Chopra, Director(Programmes), JCF

Event name: Twilight in Delhi : Exploring Tomb of  Safdarjung
Event DEscription:
Explore Heritage - Safely & Responsibily
How many times did you drive past Safdarjung Tomb not acknowledging the hidden gem inside the enclosure?
In the Late Mughal Period, the construction of the monument was the last push towards luxury and grandeur. Take this heritage walk to know the historical times, the start of Nawabi culture and the person behind its construction.
In the dusk, the tomb gains a new lease of life looking like a floating dream.
Come be part of this Arabian Night.

Important Details :
• There is no guided fee for children below 5.
• The ticket to monument (Rs 35/- or less) is not included in the guided fee.
• The medium of instruction is Hindi and English
• Please note that in case of unavoidable external reasons such as (weather conditions, political rallies, VIP movement, powercut) the walk may be canceled. The participant has the liberty to take another walk by the company against the payment they have made within 30 days since the date of the registered walk. The company does not have refund policy.
• The details of the walk are mailed to you a day prior to the walk. Please notify us in case you do not receive it.
• Please feel free to contact us on number 9667218424 or on email ZW5yb3V0ZWluZGlhbmhpc3RvcnkgfCBnbWFpbCAhIGNvbQ==

Covid – 19 Precautions Taken:
• Wearing mask is mandatory
• Contactless thermal scanner check-up
• 1 meter (3 ft.) distance maintained throughout the walk between each particpant and the speaker.
• Limited participant entry of 20.
• Contactless money transaction
• Arogya Setu App mandatory

12 men serving on a jury must decide, after hearing the trial and final arguments, on the life of a teenager who is being prosecuted for the M**der of his father. It is a matter of life or death. In the locked jury room with such high stakes, people`s personalities and problems start emerging, sometimes threatening to over shadow the case itself. There are issues of personal grievance, of inability to fit into society, of arrogance and self-importance, of low self-esteem, of aggression -- but also, idealism, integrity and compassion.

What will their verdict be? And will justice triumph?


Directed by Vikalp Mudgal. Performed by Vikalp Mudgal, Pushkar Garg, Dhruv Shetty, Piyush Jain, Neel Kamal, Javed & the Akshara Repertory.

@habitatworld @OldWorldCulture

Depot48 presents Vidya Shah

Saturday, 10th April. 630 pm.

Cover Charge of Rs. 500 includes a standard measure of a domestic beverage.

About the performance and the artist:
Vidya Shah presents Aaj Rang Hai, Songs of the season.

VIDYA SHAH is a singer and musician from New Delhi, India. She was initially trained in Carnatic music, and later received guidance in the North Indian genres of Khayal (from Shubha Mudgal and Mujahid Hussain Khan) and Thumri Dadra, and Ghazal (from Shanti Hiranand). She has performed at national and international forums, including the Tansen Samaroh in Gwalior, The Kennedy Centre in Washington D.C, The Asia Society in New York and the Bode Museum in Berlin.

A popular performer and a prolific composer, she has a comfortable command on various genres. She is a recipient of the Charles Wallace Award and a Senior Fellowship  from the Government of India for her project "Women on Record", a performance highlighting the contributions of the forgotten women performers in the Gramophone era. She writes and speaks on music and is the Author of Jalsa: Indian Women's Journey from the Salon to the Studio (Tulika Books)
She is the Nana Shirgaonkar Chair Professor for Indian Music at Goa University for 2016-20. 

Vidya is a rare combination of scholarship and music and brings this very special talent to her performances.

Event DEscription:
Experiencing occasional stress or anxiety is a common phenomenon. However, people diagnosed with an anxiety disorder, face intense, excessive & persistent worry & fear about everyday situations, often hindering their day-to-day activities.
This webinar takes you through the different anxiety disorders as well as management techniques for the same.

Date:11th April 2021
Day: Sunday
Time: 2:30 pm - 5:00pm
Fees: Rs. 899 (excluding GST)

The Workshop will be conducted by Psychologists at KCCW

Event name: Sekhem All-Love Webinar with Patrick Zeigler presented by Mindfulness Foundation
Event DEscription:
We are so happy to be hosting Online Sekhem All-Love Webinar with Patrick Zeigler for private group.


Patrick Zeigler is an internationally known spiritual teacher who incorporates Body, Mind and Spirit into each healing session; a seeker and scholar of holistic healing for over 40 years. His experience includes having worked with different Spiritual Masters in countries like Arabia, Nepal, India and Africa. He got his awakening in the year 1980, inside the King's Chamber at the Giza Pyramid in Egypt. Patrick channeled in 1984 an ancient healing method called SEICHIM/SEKHEM, which is used by thousands of people today. Currently, Patrick, his wife Sirley and son Sekhem Zi Om live in Egypt offering Sekhem All-Love online workshops, where participants restore the connection to the Source, allowing them to be more aware of their life purpose and helping them to eliminate the concepts that create the illusion of separation from the whole.


This Webinar is taking place on Zoom. This is an Online Event. Translation in Hindi will be available during webinar.  You’ll receive the link once you fill the registration Google Form:  https://forms.gle/caH1ZyGpS1hKdKsNA

Event name: Depot48 Sunday Sundowner feat. Zero Gravity
Event DEscription:
Depot48 Sunday Sundowner in association with Gordon's London Dry Gin

Join us, as Manita and Ameet, an acoustic duo as Zero Gravity(@zgravit) play your favourite pop songs for that perfect Sunday Sundowner. 

Two For One On Select Beverages.
Drink Responsibly.

About the artists:

Ameet Mayanglambam, a young guitarist from Manipur started his journey with his brother's beat-up acoustic guitar and has come a long way from rock music to blues.  Heavily inspired by artists such as Stevie Ray Vaughan, George Benson and Lee Ritenour to name a few, Ameet Mayanglambam  finds himself discover a new shade of the instrument everyday.

Music happened to Manita while working in the corporate sector 3 years back and represents the saying that it's never too late to start something good when she left her day job to dive into music. Manita Thapa, since then continues on her journey to do nothing but music.
